last_episode_to_air.name: What Makes Doogie Run
last_episode_to_air.overview: Doogie sees his gift of genius as more of a curse than a blessing as he seeks inspiration outside the world of medicine.

name: Doogie Howser, M.D.
overview: Doogie Howser is a doctor. He is also a 16-year-old genius who graduated college at age 10 and finished medical school at age 14. But he is still a teenager, with normal teenage friends and problems. But unlike a normal teenager, he is just learning to drive while also consulting on serious medical cases like heart transplants.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Doogie passes one test to get his driver's license, but he must pass another when he treats a critically ill boy.

episodes.name: The Ice Queen Cometh
episodes.overview: Doogie freezes in disbelief when he's asked out to dinner by Victoria Burke, the new radiology chief, known in some circles as "the Ice Queen."

episodes.name: A Stitch Called Wanda
episodes.overview: When Wanda's appendix ruptures with her parents out of town, Doogie ignores hospital policy to operate on her. This creates tension with Dr. Canfield as well as Wanda.

episodes.name: Frisky Business
episodes.overview: His parents' trip signals party time for Doogie and friends, whose plans include drinking beer while Doogie is on call.

episodes.name: The Short Goodbye
episodes.overview: Moving out of his parents' house proves to be an eye-opening experience for Doogie. Meanwhile, a rock star is admitted to the hospital for vocal-cord surgery.

episodes.name: Simply Irresistible
episodes.overview: After a grueling 48-hour shift amid hothouse conditions, Doogie is tempted to switch loyalties to an upscale pediatrics group eager to woo him away from Eastman.

episodes.name: Vinnie Video Vici
episodes.overview: Vinnie is no fly on the wall as he observes Doogie's personal and professional life while shooting a documentary on a day in the life of a teenage doctor.

episodes.name: Blood and Remembrance
episodes.overview: Doogie's hectic schedule prevents him from spending time with Wanda, a situation that renders him more sympathetic to a patient.

episodes.name: She Ain't Heavy, She's My Cousin
episodes.overview: Vinnie is stuck on a blind date with Wanda's "big-boned" cousin, a girl with a self-image problem not unlike a plastic-surgery patient at the hospital, who's willing to pay through the nose for a perfect body.

episodes.name: My Old Man and the Sea
episodes.overview: Doogie is invited to spend the weekend in Palm Springs with Wanda and her family, but it's the same weekend that his father picked for their annual fishing trip.

episodes.name: Tonight's the Night
episodes.overview: Doogie and Wanda are pressured by peers to get intimate; and Doogie has trouble leaving work problems at work as he deals with an unwed teenage mother.

episodes.name: Every Dog Has His Doogie
episodes.overview: At the hospital, the homeless are being turned away to make room for paying patients; and Doogie bucks the system by arranging surgery for a youngster's pet dog.

episodes.name: Doogie the Red-Nosed Reindeer
episodes.overview: Doogie feigns illness to get out of working the night shift on Christmas Eve so he can go to a party.

episodes.name: Greed Is Good
episodes.overview: Greedy friends and family have a hand out as Doogie makes the finals of a quiz show offering cash and prizes galore.

episodes.name: Attack of the Green-Eyed Monster
episodes.overview: Jealousy comes between Doogie and Wanda, and it also brings a silence between Dr. and Mrs. Howser.

episodes.name: It Ain't Over Till Mrs. Howser Sings
episodes.overview: A scare involving the results of her mammogram has Katherine intent on reviving her '60s singing career at a nightclub's open-mike night.

episodes.name: Tough Guys Don't Teach
episodes.overview: Teaching a safe-sex class in high school isn't intimidating for Dr. Doogie, but one of the students is a beefy bruiser who wants to fight Doogie after class.

episodes.name: I Never Sold Shower Heads for My Father
episodes.overview: Vinnie doesn't understand his father's urgency to involve him in the family shower-head business.

episodes.name: Doogie's Awesome, Excellent Adventure
episodes.overview: Doogie is just about as cool as a guy can get, thanks to fashion advice from the super-cool Griffin, who also thinks it's cool when Doogie "borrows" his father's BMW.

episodes.name: Use a Slurpy, Go to Jail
episodes.overview: An embittered gang member holds Vinnie and Doogie hostage during a botched convenience-store holdup in which Doogie is left to ponder prejudice.

episodes.name: Whose Mid-Life Crisis Is It Anyway
episodes.overview: When Doogie's dad decides to retire, discouraged that his research failed to make a splash in medical journals, Doogie prescribes an attitude adjustment.

episodes.name: Vinnie's Blind Date
episodes.overview: Vinnie's date with Doogie's young patient takes a romantic turn, but Vinnie fears it won't last if a cornea transplant restores her vision.

episodes.name: And the Winner Is...
episodes.overview: Doogie and McGuire put their friendship on the line while competing for the Resident of the Year award.

episodes.name: Breaking Up Is Hard to Doogie
episodes.overview: After sitting in on a marriage-counseling session, Doogie and Wanda wonder if their relationship will improve with age; McGuire defends Spaulding's honor to a boastful rival.

episodes.name: The Grass Ain't Always Greener
episodes.overview: Now free to date other women, Doogie enjoys a few evenings with a trendy philosophy student before realizing that something's missing: Wanda.

episodes.name: Frankly, My Dear, I Don't Give a Grand
episodes.overview: Vinnie is nervous about his "first time" with Janine; Doogie feels unexpected emotions over Wanda's announcement.

episodes.name: Doogenstein
episodes.overview: Doogie's heavy third-year residency duties make him fear he's missing out on his youth.

episodes.name: Guess Who's Coming to Doogie's
episodes.overview: Former gang member Raymond Alexander begins working at the hospital but his past may come back to haunt him.

episodes.name: Ask Dr. Doogie
episodes.overview: Doogie becomes famous after doing some public service announcements.

episodes.name: C'est la Vinnie
episodes.overview: Vinnie and his pregnant French teacher get stuck in an elevator.

episodes.name: Car Wars
episodes.overview: Doogie wants to buy a classic car. A mentally ill patient turns down treatment.

episodes.name: Doogie Sings the Blues
episodes.overview: Doogie treats a once popular singer who is trying to make a comeback.

episodes.name: Academia Nuts
episodes.overview: Vinnie asks to "borrow" one of Doogie's old school papers. Meanwhile, Doogie treats a wealthy hypochondriac.

episodes.name: Revenge of the Teenage Dead
episodes.overview: Vinnie makes a zombie horror movie.

episodes.name: Nautilus for Naught
episodes.overview: Doogie and a hospitalized model realize they have something in common -- being judged by how beautiful or young they look.

episodes.name: Don't Let the Turkeys Get You Down
episodes.overview: After Janine breaks up with him, Vinnie is not very thankful on Thanksgiving.

episodes.name: Oh Very Young
episodes.overview: Doogie rethinks his position on May-December relationships when he finds himself the victim of age discrimination.

episodes.name: TV or Not TV
episodes.overview: Vinnie tries to get help getting into film school from a TV network executive who's been admitted to the hospital.

episodes.name: A Woman Too Far
episodes.overview: Doogie weighs his relationship with Wanda against an attractive nursing student.

episodes.name: Presumed Guilty
episodes.overview: Doogie wrecks his father's car and tries to cover it up.

episodes.name: To Live and Die in Brentwood
episodes.overview: Wanda wants time alone after a family member dies.

episodes.name: Air Doogie
episodes.overview: Doogie joins the hospital basketball team in order to fit in.

episodes.name: A Life in Progress
episodes.overview: An AIDS-infected artist brings out everyone's true feelings about the disease.

episodes.name: My Two Dads
episodes.overview: Vinnie joins Doogie and David on a camping trip.

episodes.name: Nobody Expects the Spanish Inquisition
episodes.overview: Grandpa Howser causes problems as Doogie's parents try to renovate the kitchen.

episodes.name: Fatal Distraction
episodes.overview: Doogie and Wanda face more strains when he goes to a party with another woman.

episodes.name: The Doctor, the Wife, Her Son and the Job
episodes.overview: Doogie's mom gets a job. Unfortunately for Doogie, it's at his hospital.

episodes.name: Planet of the Dateless
episodes.overview: Two weeks of volunteer work in Mexico makes Jack reevaluate his life.

episodes.name: Doogie's Wager
episodes.overview: Vinnie awaits word of whether he's accepted to film school.

episodes.name: A Kiss Ain't Just a Kiss
episodes.overview: Problems are bound to occur when Doogie kisses Janine.

episodes.name: Dances with Wanda
episodes.overview: Doogie takes a still-grieving Wanda to the prom then introduces her to a young heart patient to rekindle her spirit for living.

episodes.name: The Summer of '91
episodes.overview: Doogie is obsessed with his virginity while a patient believes that he is her late husband.

episodes.name: Doogie Has Left the Building (1)
episodes.overview: Doogie ponders a decision affecting the life of a young patient. (Part 1 of 2)

episodes.name: Doogie Has Left the Building (2)
episodes.overview: Life at Doogie and Vinnie's pad resembles one big beer commercial, but what Doogie really needs is a listening ear. (Part 2 of 2)

episodes.name: It's a Damn Shaman
episodes.overview: Vinnie's girlfriend wants to run to Las Vegas to get married. Doogie takes on a curse to save a boy's life.

episodes.name: The Cheese Stands Alone
episodes.overview: A seductive classmate proves more temptation than Vinnie can handle, especially when Janine grows distant.

episodes.name: Lonesome Doog
episodes.overview: Doogie is a portrait of anxiety when Wanda comes home from art school and strikes up several new friendships.

episodes.name: When Doogie Comes Marching Home
episodes.overview: Doogie plays a Civil War doctor as he and Vinnie collaborate on a screenplay.

episodes.name: Doogstruck
episodes.overview: While driving to visit Wanda, Doogie's car breaks down in the desert where he meets a soul mate.

episodes.name: Room and Broad
episodes.overview: Doogie's parents want him to pay room and board; Spaulding's father doesn't want a pacemaker.

episodes.name: Doogiesomething
episodes.overview: Doogie and Wanda's efforts to be friends are put on hold after Wanda calls long-distance for advice on a new guy.

episodes.name: Truth and Consequences
episodes.overview: Doogie takes a liking to a homely librarian only after he learns she's scheduled for plastic surgery; a youth counselor's lies trap him in a kind of prison.

episodes.name: It's a Wonderful Laugh
episodes.overview: Doogie discovers the healing power of laughter after an argument with Vinnie and while treating a troubled kidney patient.

episodes.name: Dangerous Reunions
episodes.overview: Katherine relives the past with her visiting first love; Raymond starts hanging out with pals from the 'hood.

episodes.name: Mummy Dearest
episodes.overview: The examination of a mummy brings rumblings of a curse from the staff and has Doogie contemplating the limits of modern medicine.

episodes.name: Double Doogie with Cheese
episodes.overview: Vinnie bets that Doogie can't last in a "mindless" fast-food job.

episodes.name: The Show Musn't Go On
episodes.overview: An egotistical actor observes Doogie's hospital procedures to give his TV series a shot in the arm.

episodes.name: If This Is Adulthood, I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia
episodes.overview: After months of dating Cecilia, Doogie discovers what she's been hiding a 4-year-old son, who stirs Doogie's paternal instincts.

episodes.name: What You See Ain't Necessarily What You Get
episodes.overview: After taking Spaulding out for her 30th birthday, Doogie wonders if there's more fun in store for the two of them.

episodes.name: My Father, My Self
episodes.overview: While Doogie considers a career specialty, he learns that another doctor has been invited to join his father's practice.

episodes.name: Educating Janine
episodes.overview: Janine's parents split a seam when Janine forsakes college for a job in fashion.

episodes.name: Sons of the Desert
episodes.overview: Spring break in Palm Springs is just what the doctor orders for Vinnie, who pursues a jealous vendetta against Janine, and Doogie, who weighs a fellowship in trauma surgery.

episodes.name: That's What Friends Are For
episodes.overview: Doogie is anything but popular after he encourages Wanda to accept her dad's new gal and Vinnie to accept being short.

episodes.name: Thanks for the Memories
episodes.overview: Cherished memories get lost in the aging process for a patient who relies on Doogie to help him remember; and Vinnie takes a video journey of self-discovery.

episodes.name: Club Medicine
episodes.overview: The Drs. Howser spend a father-son trip at a Honduran operating theater, where Doogie gives a thumbs-down to a wisecracking surgeon.

episodes.name: There's a Riot Going On
episodes.overview: The 1992 L.A. riots find trauma surgeon Doogie overwhelmed.

episodes.name: Look Ma, No Pants
episodes.overview: Katherine can't stop playing mother to Doogie even after he dates her boss, whom he brings to the house for skinny-dipping.

episodes.name: Doogie Got a Gun
episodes.overview: After the family is robbed, Doogie considers buying a gun, but he's haunted by memories of shooting victims he's treated.

episodes.name: Doogie Doesn't Live Here Anymore
episodes.overview: Doogie hunts for new digs and finds a Venice Beach loft; and Vinnie must also find a new home when his parents divorce.

episodes.name: The Patient in Spite of Himself
episodes.overview: A med-school project has Doogie and a fellow doctor posing as patients, being poked, prodded and probed to learn how to empathize with patients.

episodes.name: To Err is Human, to Give up Isn't a Bad Idea
episodes.overview: Doogie faces his first solo surgery fearing he's not perfect; and Vinnie faces his first time voting.

episodes.name: Doogie, Can You Hear Me?
episodes.overview: A hearing-impaired patient charms Doogie, who speaks her language by signing but may not be listening. She also offers creative inspiration for Vinnie's Chaplinesque film.

episodes.name: Nothing Compares 2 U
episodes.overview: Doogie's ego takes a beating when a winsome nurse chooses Vinnie over him. Raymond also comes up short when comparing himself to other technicians.

episodes.name: Do the Right Thing ... If You Can Figure out What It Is
episodes.overview: Doogie's heart tells him to do one thing, his head another in choosing the best candidate for a heart transplant; and Vinnie's dilemma involves a vulnerable Janine.

episodes.name: The Big Sleep ... Not!
episodes.overview: Doogie holes up at the hospital on Thanksgiving Eve for some R&R, as does a new mother who feigns illness to get away from her family.

episodes.name: Will the Real Dr. Howser Please Stand Up
episodes.overview: Doogie spots evidence of child abuse when his dad's friend brings in his injured son for care.

episodes.name: The Mother of All Fishing Trips
episodes.overview: Doogie's mom makes a poor substitute as Doogie's fishing partner when Dr. Howser throws his back out and is at home being cared for by Vinnie.

episodes.name: Roommate with a View
episodes.overview: Doogie learns a lesson about trusting the unknown from a free-spirited model sharing his loft, as does a kidney-transplant candidate.

episodes.name: Spell It M-A-N
episodes.overview: A nurse Doogie's dating retaliates against his braggadocio by spreading rumors about him; Vinnie gets a new film-school dormmate.

episodes.name: It's a Tough Job ... But Why Does My Father Have to Do It?
episodes.overview: Vinnie can't adjust to the masseuse his father is dating; Doogie's dad is asked to replace a doctor who expired while on duty.

episodes.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Howser
episodes.overview: Doogie as Sherlock Holmes and Vinnie as Dr. Watson play out Doogie's confusion over Michele.

episodes.name: Love Means Constantly Having to Say You're Sorry
episodes.overview: Laura makes Vinnie feel he's "become a man," but he reacts with adolescent jealousy to men around her. Meanwhile, a traveler's illness puzzles Doogie.

episodes.name: You've Come a Long Way, Baby-Sitter
episodes.overview: Some things are better left unexplored, like Doogie's crush on his old baby sitter or Vinnie's dream of having a star read his script.

episodes.name: Love Makes the World go 'Round ... or is It Money?
episodes.overview: A deposit error dumping $16,000 in Vinnie's account tests his integrity; and Doogie must prove his integrity to a girl with a crush on him.

episodes.name: Dorky Housecall, M.D.
episodes.overview: Doogie bemoans his friendship-only status with Michele but finds inspiration on how to deal with it from an acerbic cartoonist patient.

episodes.name: Eleven Angry People ... and Vinnie
episodes.overview: Jury member Vinnie tries to look beyond the letter of the law, as does Doogie, who uncovers a bogus doctor at Eastman.

episodes.name: What Makes Doogie Run
episodes.overview: Doogie sees his gift of genius as more of a curse than a blessing as he seeks inspiration outside the world of medicine.
